Another Security Hole In Ie5

25 Aug 1999

News.com was the first to report another\n security hole in IE5.

The problem goes back to an ActiveX control that \nshipped with IE5 that can allow a malicious webmaster to place a program on a victim's hard disk that will be\nexecuted at the next reboot. The bug can be exploited from a user opening a web page or reading an email.\n

\n MS has acknowledged the security hole, and says it will have a patch out within\n the week.

\nAre bugs like this, or worse, viruses like Melissa going to be the norm as a result of tighter 'application integration'\n that MS has been touting for years?

\n
